greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} A123706(n,k)*2^(k-1).
comment: Triangle A123706 is the matrix inverse of triangle A010766(n,k) = [n/k].
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
formula: G.f.: Sum_{k>=1} mu(k) * x^k * (1 - x^k) / (1 - 2*x^k). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Feb 06 2020
mathematica: t[n_, k_] := If[Divisible[n, k], MoebiusMu[n/k], 0] - If[Divisible[n, k + 1], MoebiusMu[n/(k + 1)], 0]; Table[Sum[t[n, k]*2^(k - 1), {k, 1, n}], {n, 1, 50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Oct 26 2017 *)
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Oct 09 2006
